H0.text: Reflected is what most of the sunlight that strikes a snow‑covered surface does, which is why people often wear sunglasses in polar regions.

H1.text: Absorbed is what most of the sunlight that strikes a snow‑covered surface does in polar regions, which is why people often wear sunglasses.

H2.text: Refracted is most of the sunlight that strikes a snow‑covered surface, which is why people often wear sunglasses in polar regions.

H3.text: Transmitted is the fact that most of the sunlight that strikes a snow‑covered surface is transmitted, which is why people often wear sunglasses in polar regions.

A4.text: Fresh snow has an albedo as high as 0.9.

A5.text: Dirty snow has an albedo as low as 0.2.

A6.text: Mountaineers are exposed to higher-than-ordinary levels of UV radiation, both because there is less atmospheric filtering and because of reflection from snow and ice.
